pull.title: cli: restrict multiple exclusive argument usage in bitcoin-cli
pull.body: This PR is a continuation of the validation suggested [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27815) to ensure that only one Request Handler can be specified at a time.

events.message:
cli: restrict multiple exclusive argument usage in bitcoin-cli

Co-authored-by: Brotcrunsher <Brotcrunsher@hotmail.de>

events.body:
> This is very close to @Brotcrunsher's original commit. At the very least they should be a co-author.

I've added the co-author.

ACK for 628d2d4173660c1ad35b2d84524f71b92593d7cd

Thanks for picking this up.  Built and ran all functional tests (all passed).  Manually executed `bitcoin-cli` with one and multiple instances of the argument group covered by this PR.  The error was seen (as expected) if more than one argument of the group was specified.

Left a few notes.

comments.body: The implicit conversions from bool to int seem safe (at least at first glance, https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/implicit_conversion), but I didn't get a change to dig into C++ standard docs to check.  It is a tiny bit unintuitive for a reader, but this doesn't seem too cryptic and seems cleaner than the separate `if` statements and temp variable used in 27815.
